comments:
Hi,

I've upgraded to 3.2M5a event though it is said it is not necessary so am not sure if this is a bug or not, yet report it, so it might not hit later people upgrading to M6.

When I start M5a shortly after displaying the splash screen a dialog appears telling me an error occured and reffering me to a log file. The content of said file is posted below.

If I start M5 (installed in a different directory, but using the same Workspace and same $HOME/.eclipse directory) everyting works as expected.

$ cat /home/claudio/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.0/configuration/1142111265969.log

I just recognize that the statement "using the same Workspace" is just guessing, as eclipse does not reach the point I could see which workspace it opens. But in any case I did not specify on the commandline a different workspace. This is how I called eclipse:

$ /usr/local/java/eclipse/eclipse

$ /usr/local/java/eclipse-3.2M5/eclipse

($ ist the shell prompt)

/usr/local/eclipse contains 3.2M5a while /usr/local/java/eclipse-3.2M5 contains 3.2M5 as indicated by the name.
I could solve the problem by starting eclipse 3.2M5a with the -clean option once.
Are you installing eclipse as read-only?

Sort of yes. I created a user i-eclipse and unpacked the eclipse tar into /usr/local/java beeing this user. This user is used only for this purpose.

When I work, and also when I created the crash I reported here, I always so it as user claudio. This user has no write permissions to any file below /usr/local/java/eclipse. So it is read-only.

Then I have $HOME/Eclipse owned by claudio with two subdirectories Workspace and AddOns.

Workspace is as the name implies my workspace directory.

AddOns is where I install the addons as user claudio. I do not install any plugins as user i-eclipse.

Currently I have just subclipse plugin. 

 ls -l $HOME/Eclipse/AddOns/eclipse/*/
/home/claudio/Eclipse/AddOns/eclipse/features/:
total 4
drwxr-xr-x  4 claudio claudio 4096 2006-02-22 14:22 org.tigris.subversion.subclipse_0.9.106

/home/claudio/Eclipse/AddOns/eclipse/plugins/:
total 12
drwxr-xr-x  2 claudio claudio 4096 2006-02-22 14:22 org.tigris.subversion.subclipse_0.9.106
drwxr-xr-x  5 claudio claudio 4096 2006-02-22 14:22 org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.core_0.9.106
drwxr-xr-x  5 claudio claudio 4096 2006-02-22 14:22 org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.ui_0.9.106


The reason for this set up is, that I want to install never eclipse releases "cleanly" without the need to reinstall addons or having my user settings mixed in with the installed eclipse.
 
So when I installed 3.2M5a I did as user i-eclipse just this

cd /usr/local/java/
mv eclipse eclipse-3.2M5
tar xzvf /var/tmp/eclipse-SDK-3.2M5a-linux-gtk.tar.gz

This way I still have the previous version 3.2M5 available if the new one has problems, and the new one is installed in a fresh eclipse directory.
